basics.name: Alexander DiCaprio
basics.label: Data and AI Product Strategist
basics.summary: IT professional with 20 years of experience in leading the design, development, communication, and implementation of data-driven and AI-powered solutions that enable business decisions and improve operational efficiencies.

work.name: U.S. Department of State - Center for Analytics
work.summary: Strategist transforming how the Department leverages Artificial Intelligence to enhance data-driven diplomacy, streamline workflows, and build AI capacity.
highlights: Architect of the Department of State's AI Marketplace, enabling users to identify, qualify, and deploy trusted AI platforms.
Deployed a governed cloud based data science and AI sandbox environment in Azure Databricks, serving over 1,000 Department of State data scientists worldwide.

Managed project team of over 20 contractors to enhance data access to R and Python, enable citizen developers build AI tools with API endpoints, and enable version CI/CD pipelines through Github Enterprise.
Managed stakeholder engagement and communications with over 50 Department of State bureaus, offices, and embassies to build consensus on AI roadmap strategy and implementation.

work.name: ADiCaprio Management Consulting, LLC
work.summary: Delivered human-centered data solutions to drive business decisions, improve operational efficiencies, and enhance overall performance.
highlights: Developed Data Management and Data Governance frameworks, data strategies, and wireframes to support the development of Monitoring and Evaluation databases.
Automated business processes for client though Power Platform development realizing over $100K in cost savings.

work.name: MetaPhase Consulting
work.summary: Director of federal contracts, focusing on leading data-driven development initiatives across the federal government.
highlights: Managed and mentored team of over 20 data scientists spread across multiple Federal Government Agencies.
Developed foundational strategic Data Management and Governance frameworks for collecting, standardizing, and managing data.
Developed a Data and AI literacy framework.
Lead Data Analytics capability and architected data governance practices and automations to improve data quality, accessibility, and security.
Captured over $20M in federal contracts through business development.

work.name: Booz Allen Hamilton
work.summary: IT Project Manager leading complex IT data analytics projects and programs across multiple federal agencies and cross-functional teams.
highlights: Leveraged both Agile and traditional Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) frameworks for project execution.
Managed data driven initiatives to automate processes and streamline workflows for increased efficiency.
Developed and implemented data models, BI dashboards, and reporting solutions to enable data-driven insights.

work.name: Boeing
work.summary: Applied data analytics and Earned Value Management (EVM) techniques to manage material costs, integrate schedules, and maintain performance measurement baselines.
highlights: Applied Earned Value Management (EVM) techniques to establish and analyze cost/schedule baselines and resolve critical path conflicts.
Designed and implemented an automated database to reconcile $300M inventory procurements, reducing setup time from 2 weeks to under a day.
Led a cross-functional team to automate a manual process, achieving over $100K in documented cost savings.

projects.name: Funhouse
projects.description: Architected an Azure Databricks based data science sandbox that allowed over 1000 data scientists across the Department of State to experiment with secure open source python and R packages and Azure AI service.  The solution was goverened by a SDK that allowed us to track usage, enhance functionality, and simplify complex code structures.

projects.name: AI Marketplace
projects.description: Developed strategic vision for the Department of State's AI Marketplace -- a human-centered interface to help users across the Department locate trusted AI platforms.  Lead over a hundred hours of customer and stakeholder interviews, designed an AI Maturity Pillar model that identified key considerations on AI usage including ethics and Bias that we risk as we continue to build and deploy AI solutions.

projects.name: Human Resources Automation
projects.description: Built Power Platform solution that automated multiple HR workflows across MetaPhase Consulting. The soution leveraged Power Apps, Bower BI, Power Automate, and SharePoint and allowed rapid development of organizational charts, tracking of transactional HR Audit logs, and management and approvals of organizational awards and trainings.

projects.name: Data Literacy Framework
projects.description: Architected the Data Literacy Framework and maturity model that defined the strategic goals on building an Data and AI informed USCIS.  Specifically through the identification of key skills, competencies, and learning pathways to build capacity over time.

projects.name: Data Strategy
projects.description: Advisory to the Chief Data Officer to manage the deployment the initial USCIS Data Strategy. Specifically through the development of a comprehensive review of the organizational structures, identification of vision, goals, and objectives, alignment to Executive Orders and Congressional Mandates, and office skill assessments.

projects.name: Machine Learning and Data Analytics
projects.description: Managed the transformation, migration and automation of a massive excel based report to Python/SQL Databricks notebooks and Tableau, reducing a 30 day process down to 3 days while increasing organizational transparency through Dashboard views of datasets.  Tasks included market research, customer outreach, automation of data pipelines, data wrangling and human centered Tableau dashboard development.

education.institution: Case Western Reserve University - Weatherhead School of Management
courses: MIDS 470 - Analyzing Mobility and Mobile e-business

awards.title: Superior Honors
awards.summary: For development of technologies that support data-driven diplomacy.

awards.title: Superior Honors
awards.awarder: Department of State - Assistant Secretary Phee
awards.summary: For developing a data-visualization product saving over $750,000.
